business.headline: Old vs new income tax regime: What to choose if you earn Rs 50 lakh per yearTaxpayers should consider a few key factors before making a choice. The old regime allows deductions, whereas the new regime offers lower tax rates but no major deductions.

Government to lapse $23 billion scheme to boost domestic manufacturing: ReportThe Production-Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme, introduced in 2020, aimed to increase manufacturing's share of India's economy to 25% by 2025.

SBI Card Flexipay: Know how to convert credit card payments into EMIsOne can convert transactions of Rs 500 or more into EMIs under SBI Card's Flexipay option. It offers multiple repayment tenure options, such as three, six, nine, 12, 18 and 24 months.

Smallcap, midcap stocks gain momentum. Good news for mutual funds too?Given the correction, some analysts have indicated that quality smallcap and midcap stocks could start regaining some momentum. But does this apply to smallcap and midcap mutual funds too?

Rupee heads for best week in 2 years as dollar inflows riseAt 1 pm, the rupee was trading at 86.07 against the US dollar, extending its weekly gain to 0.72%. This marks the strongest weekly performance for the rupee since 2022.

Is the foreign selling crisis finally over on Dalal Street?Foreign investors turned net buyers in two of the last four sessions, sparking a market rally. While selling pressure has eased, is the months-long foreign outflow crisis finally coming to an end?

Morgan Stanley to layoff 2,000 employees to boost efficiencySeveral renowned banks have been reducing their workforce recently as they brace for economic uncertainty following President Donald Trump's newly announced trade tariffs.

Tata Group quietly becomes Tesla's global supplier: ReportTata firms have already signed global agreements with Tesla and are supplying various parts and services and their involvement is expected to grow further.

Unified Pension Scheme: Who can join and how much to contributeUPS will be available to central government employees who meet specific criteria. This includes existing employees under NPS as of 1st April 2025. It also includes newly recruited employees joining central government services on or after April 1, 2025.
Can AI pick winning stocks on Dalal Street? Check out these toolsOne of the major advantages of using AI is that it takes care of the labour-intensive aspects of trading efficiently, as per experts.

Pakistan plans to legalise cryptocurrency to tackle economic slowdownNearly 15-20 million Pakistanis are already trading digital assets. Further, countries like the US and UAE are embracing crypto-friendly policies, making it crucial for Pakistan to stay competitive.

Sensex climbs over 600 points. Check key reasons behind stock market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 604.77 points to trade at 76,952.83 at 12:37 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 175.35 points to 23,366. Adding to the cheer was the continued rally in smallcap and midcap segments.

Bajaj Finance shares rally over 3% to reach record high, analysts bullishShares of the non-banking financial company rose 3.5% in early trade to reach a day's high of 9,070. At around 10:35 am, shares of the company were trading 2.43% higher at Rs 8,891.15 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
RVNL shares rise 4% as railway PSU bags Rs 555 crore project. Check detailsThe shares of RVNL were trading 4.18% higher at Rs 373 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

This woman earned $350 million a day but lost $3.6 billion in 3 daysMarina Bumdiman had accumulated a fortune of $7.5 billion, making her the richest woman in Indonesia. However, the rapid rise was followed by an equally sharp fall. In just three days, her net worth was cut in half, wiping out $3.6 billion.

Ola Electric shares jump over 6% after clarification on February sales dataOla Electric Mobility's share price rose over 6% on the Bombay Stock Exchange in early trade after an important clarification.

Accenture revenue forecast hits IT stocks, Infosys, Wipro fallAccenture, which is seen as a key indicator for the Indian IT sector, raised the lower end of its annual revenue forecast but kept the upper end unchanged.

Ola Electric explains February sales mismatch: Temporary backlog in registrationsOla Electric addressed concerns about the mismatch in a stock exchange filing, saying that daily registrations have now exceeded 50% of its three-month daily sales average.

Sensex, Nifty opening predictions on March 21: What to expect todayBSE, NSE today: Nifty has posted gains for four straight sessions this week, marking its longest winning streak in nearly seven weeks.

Stocks to watch on March 21: TCS, HUL, Zomato, Adani Enterprises, Jio FinancialSeveral stocks will be in focus today due to recent developments. These include Hindustan Unilever (HUL), Jio Financial, Adani Enterprises, Infosys, TCS, Bajaj Finance, Zomato, and others.

Planning taxes for FY2026? Which regime to pick- old or new?The old tax regime offers over 70 deductions and exemptions, including HRA, LTA, Section 80C, 80D, home loan interest, and education loan interest. Meanwhile, the new tax regime has simplified slabs but does not offer these deductions.

US stock market opening: Wall Street opens lower as tariff concerns resurfaceDarden Restaurants Inc. was the biggest gainer, climbing by 6.52%, at the opening bell. Others in the green zone included Jabil Inc., up by 4.09%, Solventum Corp., which rose by 2.41% and TransDigm Group Inc., which climbed by 2.15%.

EPFO speeds up claim processing, 60% settled via automated systemTo further quicken the process, EPFO has automated claims related to medical emergencies, housing, studies, and marriage costs. With this system in place, claims are now processed within just three days.

Daughter's future? Which is better- Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana or ELSS?SSY offers 8.2% as an annual interest rate. Investors can invest a minimum of Rs 250, while the maximum limit is Rs 1.5 lakh per year. Further, this scheme allows tax benefits under Sector 80C of the Income Tax Act 1961.

Money after divorce: How courts calculate alimonyAlimony in India does not follow a fixed formula. Courts consider various factors such as the financial position of both spouses, their earning potential, and their contributions to the marriage.

Jio Financial, Allianz likely reach deal for insurance joint venture in India: ReportJio Financial Services has reached an initial deal for a joint venture with Allianz SE to form an insurance business in India.

Worker regrets moving from Noida to Bengaluru for Rs 30,000 hike. Here's whyIn a recent social media post, a corporate employee described Bengaluru as "dirty, unorganised," with bad roads and the worst traffic. Apart from infrastructure issues, the worker also mentioned feeling a "north vs south" divide in everyday interactions.

Air India in talks to buy more widebody jets from Airbus and Boeing: ReportThe potential order is expected to be worth billions of dollars and could help the airline expand its long-haul fleet as it undergoes a major transformation under Tata Group ownership.

Nithin Kamath's advice to investors amid market volatility : 'Cut your losers'Zerodha's Nithin Kamath shared an essential trading rule that is knowing when to exit a bad trade. Kamath explained that traders often hold on to losing positions, hoping they will recover. But instead of hoping, traders should act with caution and cut their losses early.

IndiGo shares soar after recent update, hit record high. Buy, sell or hold?In just 5 trading sessions, the stock has soared roughly 8%. IndiGo's stock is up over 10% this year and nearly 13% in a month. The latest jump in its share price came after the company recently shared its roadmap for FY30.

Government simplifies compounding rules, relaxes process for tax defaultersThe move aims to provide relief to taxpayers, to settle matters smoothly with the tax authorities and reduce unnecessary litigation.

Exiting foreign investors hurt Dalal Street rally, especially IT stocksContinued selling by foreign portfolio investors (FPIs), which persisted in the first half of March, could hurt market sentiment. FPIs mostly sold information technology (IT) and consumer goods stocks, with lingering concerns over the US and Indian economies.

film's limited screen releases.

Court rules in ADOR's favour, halts K-pop group NewJeans' independent activitiesThe Seoul Central District Court has ruled in favour of ADOR, affirming its exclusive management rights over the K-pop group NewJeans. This comes after the group went independent and rebranded themselves as NJZ.

Despite Gal Gadot's standout performance as the Evil Queen and impressive visuals, the film lacks emotional depth and leaves little impact.

Did Apoorva Mukhija create trouble, yell at Sabrina Carpenter's Paris concert?Social media influencer Apoorva Mukhija, known as The Rebel Kid, allegedly caused a disruption at Sabrina Carpenter's concert. Video of her from the concert is going viral.

general news.headline: Mapping India's GDB: Survey reveals how states fare in social behaviourIndia might be the fastest-growing economy, but how does it fare on social indicators like civic behaviour, safety, gender attitudes and diversity? Independent of probe into cash row: Top Court on High Court judge's transferThe Supreme Court clarified today that Justice Yashwant Varma's transfer to the Allahabad High Court is unrelated to the alleged cash recovery from his residence, emphasising that the in-house inquiry is proceeding separately as per procedure.

Delhi HC judge with cash stash at home heaped praise on UPIHeaps of cash were found at the official residence of Delhi High Court judge Yashwant Varma by firefighters who were called to fight a fire. In 2023, Justice Varma heaped praise on UPI, India's indigenous digital transaction interface. UPI is intended to reduce cash transactions, thereby hurting the black economy.

18 protesting BJP MLAs suspended, carried out of Karnataka Assembly by marshalsThe Karnataka Speaker suspended 18 BJP MLAs for six months after they disrupted proceedings over a honey-trap scandal and a bill that gives 4 per cent quota to Muslims in public contracts. Singing 'ye reshmi zulfein' in work meet not sexual harassment: Bombay High CourtThe Bombay High Court quashed an Internal Complaints Committee report and an Industrial Court ruling against a bank employee accused of workplace sexual harassment. March Madness 2025: I'm cutting It close, says Barack Obama as he unveils annual bracketThe 2025 March Madness season has begun with fans choosing their favourites. Former U.S. President Barack Obama has revealed his picks for the NCAA Tournament.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
